column3:
Qhoterl Pasol is attempting, unsuccessfully, to close her nostrils.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Deliver the requested items to Qhoterl Pasol.

<If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),16))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Mine splendid natron in the depths of Lake Tusi Mek'ta<Else/>Deliver the splendid natron to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),17))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Gather splendid marimo in the depths of Lake Tusi Mek'ta<Else/>Deliver the splendid marimo to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),18))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Spearfish a splendid sponge in the depths of Lake Tusi Mek'ta<Else/>Deliver the splendid sponge to Qhoterl Pasol</If><Else/></If></If></If>.
Sometimes I wish I didn't have such a sensitive nose. When the workers come back from the caves, they carry with them the most pungent of odors! It really is quite unbearable!

Unfortunately, even a thorough scrubbing with warm water does little to remove the stench. I fear there is little choice but to resort to a rarely used treatment, and as you can imagine, the ingredients required are also rather rare themselves...
First, I'll need roughly three pinches of natron. Your cooperation will be most appreciated, I assure you!
First, I'll need roughly three marimo. Your cooperation will be most appreciated, I assure you!

First, I'll need a sponge, the living sort, but you'll need to hook the little scoundrel with your spear as they're far too crafty to take any bait. Your cooperation will be most appreciated, I assure you!
In order to proceed with this quest, you must first complete the quest “A New Fishing Ex-spear-ience” and unlock spearfishing.
Oh! I forgot to mention that you'll need to dive into the waters of Lake Tusi Mek'ta to find it!
Oh! I forgot to mention that you'll need to dive into the waters of Lake Tusi Mek'ta to find them!
It seems that Lake Tusi Mek'ta is relatively free of large, flesh-eating beasts, so your chances of being devoured alive are actually quite low! Welcome news, I'm sure!
Have you brought what I asked for? Please say you have!
Marvelous! Once the concoction is ready, those reeking reprobates will be the very pinnacle of cleanliness in just a few scrubs!
At the top of my list of candidates are my husband and son. Their combined stench is enough to curdle milk!
